meanings.definition: Make known (information that was previously kept secret)
meanings.sent1: She decided to divulge the surprise party to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: He finally chose to divulge his true feelings to his crush.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to divulge the hiding spot of the mouse to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to divulge the beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The detective hoped the suspect would divulge the truth during questioning.

meanings.sent1: The magician will divulge his trick at the end of the show.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to divulge her password to anyone.
meanings.sent3: The diary seemed to want to divulge its secrets to the curious reader.
meanings.sent4: The old map seemed to divulge the location of hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious letter finally began to divulge its sender's identity.
